assessments.task_description:
Throughout the semester, students will complete five short in-class quizzes designed to support your learning and deepen your understanding of core disciplinary concepts. Scheduled at regular intervals (Weeks 4, 7, 9, 10, and 12), these low-stakes, formative assessments encourage continuous engagement with key theories, frameworks, and ideas that underpin the course. Each quiz provides timely feedback to help you track your progress, identify areas for improvement, and build confidence in applying knowledge. The quizzes are purposefully aligned with the concepts you'll use in your final creative project, helping ensure you're well-prepared to make informed, evidence-based decisions in your applied work. Your best four quiz scores will count toward your final grade.

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
As the first stage of the team-based behaviour change project, each student will complete an individual scoping report to investigate the background, context, and behavioural dimensions of a selected social issue. The scoping phase is a critical component of social marketing strategy development, as it ensures that any proposed intervention is informed by a comprehensive understanding of the issue, its target audience, and the factors influencing current behaviour.

This assessment requires students to undertake independent research and apply relevant social marketing theories and frameworks to analyse the behavioural problem. By doing so, students will generate evidence-based insights to inform the team’s subsequent design of personas and intervention strategies. The report should demonstrate critical thinking, theoretical application, and an understanding of ethical and contextual considerations relevant to the social issue.

Report Requirements:

The scoping report must include the following components:

  1. Issue Overview – A concise explanation of the identified social issue or behavioural challenge, including justification for why action is needed.
  2. Situation Analysis – A structured analysis including a SWOT analysis, competitor review (where applicable), and a brief literature review summarising current knowledge of the issue.
  3. Target Audience Profile – Identification and analysis of key audience segments affected by the issue, with consideration of behavioural, demographic, and psychographic factors.
  4. Marketing Exchange and Value Proposition – A proposed exchange that articulates the value the intervention will offer the target audience to support behaviour change.
  5. Draft Interview Protocol – An initial set of interview questions designed to elicit insights from target audience members in subsequent team-based research.

Report Submission Details:

  • Format: Professional report format with clear headings and logical structure
  • Word Limit: 1,500 words (excluding TOC, appendices and tables)
  • Presentation Requirements: Font: 11-point; Line spacing: 1.5; Margins: 2.5 cm

Further details, including a comprehensive assessment guide and marking rubric, will be provided in lectures and made available via the Assessment folder on Blackboard.

AI Statement

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI technologies, successful completion of this assessment will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Social Change Project - Part A - Persona Design and Report
assessments.task_description:
Students will form a team of FIVE students from their tutorial class to complete a creative, applied social marketing project. This project requires the use of social marketing concepts, behavioural theory, and a design thinking approach to develop a human-centred behaviour change strategy. The project is completed in two parts, this report (Social Change Project - Part A - Persona Design and Report) and a group presentation (Social Change Project - Part B - Team Social Marketing Strategy Pitch).

Persona Design and Report

In this component, students will generate evidence-based persona that represents the target audience impacted by the identified social issue. Persona design is a foundational step in developing effective social marketing interventions, as it deepens understanding of audience behaviours, motivations, and barriers. Drawing on primary research, personas guide the design of tailored and empathetic behaviour change strategies.

The report must include the following components:

  1. Social change problem statement – Clearly defines and justifies the behavioural problem, its societal impact, and how it informs target market selection and persona design.
  2. Customer orientation – Insights generated from two primary interviews with members of the target audience.
  3. Empathy mapping – Visual and analytical representation of the audience’s thoughts, feelings, behaviours, and pain points.
  4. Persona design – Includes name, image, demographic and psychographic details, and visual elements such as mood images.
  5. Appendix – Full interview transcripts of two interviews completed.

Report Submission Requirements:

  • Format: Professional report style with clear headings and logical structure
  • Word Limit: 1,500 words (excluding appendices and tables)
  • Formatting: Font: 11-point; Line spacing: 1.5; Margins: 2.5 cm

Further details, including a comprehensive assessment guide and marking rubric, will be provided in lectures and made available via the Assessment folder on Blackboard.

Please Note: A Buddycheck peer evaluation must be completed as part of the your group presentation (see Social Change Project - Part B - Team Social Marketing Strategy Pitch).

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Social Change Project - Part B - Team Social Marketing Strategy Pitch
assessments.due_date:
Week 13 Mon - Week 13 Fri

During your scheduled tutorial class.
assessments.task_description:
Team Social Marketing Strategy Pitch - Group Mark 25%

Building on the insights from Part A, the same team as Part A, will deliver a 20-minute oral presentation (including 5 min Q&A) that outlines their proposed social marketing strategy to peers and tutors during scheduled Week 13 sessions. The presentation will be guided by the design thinking process and must demonstrate the team’s ability to apply social marketing theory, communicate behavioural insights, and justify their strategic approach.

The presentation must include:

  1. A clearly defined problem statement focused on a specific target audience.
  2. Justification of target market selection, supported by four consumer interviews.
  3. Presentation of persona design, including behavioural insights.
  4. Explanation of the proposed behaviour change intervention.
  5. Behaviour change journey map linked to the identified persona.
  6. Discussion of strategy implications, including potential opportunities and barriers.
  7. Ethical considerations relevant to the proposed intervention.
  8. Evaluation plan for measuring campaign impact.
  9. Supporting portfolio of evidence, including interview data and analysis.

Presentation Requirements:

  • All team members must participate in the presentation.
  • Presentations will be assessed on both content and delivery.
  • Presentation times will be scheduled in-class during Week 13.

Team Social Marketing Strategy Pitch - Individual Q&A Mark 10%

Your individual contribution to the design solution presentation will be assessed individually based on professional knowledge, presentation skills (working effectively as a team member) and capacity to effectively answer strategy questions at the end of the group presentation.

Teamwork and Peer Assessment: Effective teamwork is essential for the success of this project. All teams must complete a team contract to guide team operations (a template will be provided). Peer contribution will be assessed using Buddycheck, the UQ group peer assessment tool available on Blackboard. Students whose contributions are assessed as significantly below that of their peers may receive a reduced mark.

Peer assessments must be submitted by the end of the day following your team’s presentation. If you experience issues within your team, it is important to notify your tutor as early as possible.

Students are encouraged to complete the online edX course “Working in Teams: A Practical Guide” to support effective team functioning. A link to this resource is available on Blackboard.

Please Note: The presentation will be recorded for marking purposes per UQ Policy.

AI Statement

AI May be used during the preparation for your group presentation, however the use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted during any part of the presentation. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submissions are not accepted for in-class presentations. Failure to present at the scheduled time will result in a mark of zero.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
